name: Riyank Mukhopadhyay
title: Machine Learning Engineer
tagline: Specializing in Generative AI, Computer Vision & Cloud Infrastructure
summary: Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Generative AI, Computer Vision, and Cloud Infrastructure. Proven track record of building scalable ML systems, optimizing RAG applications, and deploying production-ready AI solutions on AWS. Specialized in multi-agent systems, vector databases, and serverless architectures.

experience.description: Leading ML infrastructure and RAG-based AI systems development
bullets: Automated cloud infrastructure provisioning using Terraform and Jenkins, deploying ASUGPT, MyAIBuilder, and custom APIs across POC, Beta, and Production environments on AWS

Developed a serverless Data Indexer leveraging data ingestion in AWS OpenSearch Serverless/Cluster, MemoryDB, Azure Cognitive Search, and Milvus vector databases, enabling scalable indexing of 35+ file formats via multi-stage Docker builds on Kaniko

Designed and implemented a custom vector index for multi-agent RAG-based search and retrieval, optimizing context-aware responses for the DSL AI Companion Chatbot using course materials from BIO-181 (Canvas LMS)

Architected the Integration Engine, an API-based ETL platform for real-time data ingestion into vector databases from data sources such as Guru, ServiceNow, Canvas, and iSearch, leveraging a serverless architecture with a cron-based scheduling system
Developed a scalable OCR endpoint for multimodal LLM support, enabling advanced text extraction from handwritten documents and images in a fully serverless environment

Enhanced ingestion speeds by 3x for large-scale RAG applications, reducing bottlenecks in chunking, tokenization, and embedding stages using parallel processing, batching, and optimized multi-threading techniques

experience.description: Computer vision systems for sports biomechanics analysis
bullets: Maintained, tuned, and developed new features by enhancing the end-to-end AI project lifecycle (2D/3D Pose estimation models, Golf swing detection, Ball tracking) for over 5K customers
Enabled multi-GPU Training Support using CUDA programming for 2D/3D training pipelines resulting in 66% decreased training time
Performed a key role in moving the on-premises infrastructure to Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform for model training
Developed an interactive GUI application for selectively tracking and recognizing multiple individuals using a multi-camera setup for cross-view 3D gait recognition in real-time

Implemented an approach for generating 3D point clouds of human bodies from multiple viewpoints using a stereo camera system, achieving an accuracy rate of 94.7% for over 100 individuals in challenging co-variate conditions

projects.title: SARAH: Semi-Automated Rehabilitation at Home
projects.subtitle: ASU Geometric Media Lab
projects.description: Computer vision-based rehabilitation system for assessing upper extremity movement quality in stroke survivors, improving adaptive therapy assessments based on the Action Research Arm Test (ARAT).
projects.challenge: Stroke survivors need continuous assessment of upper extremity movement quality to optimize rehabilitation therapy, but manual assessments are time-consuming and subjective.
projects.solution: Developed an automated computer vision system using Detectron2 for object detection with intelligent tracking, achieving 90%+ accuracy in detecting 16 different ARAT objects across 106 patients. Enhanced 3D hand-mesh reconstruction using RGBD image data and transformer-based models.
highlights: Three-angle viewing system for comprehensive assessment

projects.title: Interactively Summarizing Reinforcement Learning Policies
projects.subtitle: Data Visualization, ASU
projects.description: Interactive visualization interface for manipulating the Comprehensible Abstract Policy Summaries (CAPS) algorithm for training RL agents on OpenAI Gym environments (Mountain Car and Lunar Lander).
projects.challenge: Reinforcement learning policies are often black boxes, making it difficult to understand and debug agent behavior. Researchers need interpretable visualizations to improve policy optimization.
projects.solution: Built an interactive visualization dashboard that exposes Action/Reward/Value distributions, enabling detailed exploration and analysis of RL model policies. The system facilitated a deeper understanding of policy summarization effects.
highlights: Mountain Car and Lunar Lander environments

projects.title: ASUGPT & MyAIBuilder
projects.subtitle: Production AI Chatbot Platform
projects.description: Enterprise-scale RAG-based chatbot platform serving Arizona State University community with multi-agent architecture and real-time data ingestion from multiple sources.
projects.challenge: Build a scalable, production-ready AI chatbot platform that can ingest data from 35+ file formats, integrate with multiple enterprise data sources, and provide context-aware responses to thousands of users.
projects.solution: Architected a serverless platform on AWS with automated infrastructure provisioning via Terraform, custom vector indexing in OpenSearch, and an Integration Engine for real-time ETL from Canvas, ServiceNow, Guru, and iSearch. Enhanced ingestion speeds by 3x through parallel processing optimization.
highlights: Supports 35+ file formats with serverless indexing
Real-time data sync from 4+ enterprise sources
Deployed across POC, Beta, and Production environments

projects.title: Anomaly Detection in Time-Series Data
projects.subtitle: Statistical Machine Learning, ASU
projects.description: Supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques for detecting anomalies in time-series Walmart financial data with 90% accuracy using F1 performance metrics.
projects.challenge: Identify anomalies in large-scale time-series retail data using both labeled and unlabeled approaches, optimizing for both accuracy and computational efficiency.
projects.solution: Applied multiple algorithms including XGBoost, SVM, MLP, KNN for supervised learning, and One-Class SVM, Isolation Forest, DBSCAN, Prophet, and GluonTS for unsupervised detection. Evaluated performance using MAE, MSE, and F1 metrics.

projects.title: Automated Warehouse Scheduling using Answer Set Programming
projects.subtitle: Knowledge Representation, ASU
projects.description: Automated warehouse scheduling system using Answer Set Programming (ASP) with Clingo to optimize order processing in warehouses like Amazon.
projects.challenge: Optimize warehouse order processing with complex constraints including robot movement, shelf manipulation, and product delivery while minimizing returns.
projects.solution: Implemented warehouse-specific constraints and actions using ASP with Clingo, employing rigorous testing and step-by-step approach to break down complex scenarios, leading to optimal scheduling solutions.
highlights: Robot movement and shelf manipulation logic

projects.title: Image Recognition as a Service
projects.subtitle: Cloud Computing, ASU
projects.description: Scalable cloud-based image recognition service using AWS EC2, SQS, and S3 with auto-scaling capabilities.
projects.challenge: Build a scalable serverless application that can handle multiple concurrent image recognition requests efficiently while managing resources dynamically.
projects.solution: Hosted Flask web server on AWS EC2 using SQS request queue to scale the app tier with a greedy approach creating an app-tier EC2 instance for every 4 requests. Developed serverless application for face recognition on classroom videos, storing images and results in S3 buckets.
highlights: Auto-scaling based on request queue depth
Greedy scaling algorithm (1 instance per 4 requests)
S3 integration for image and result storage

projects.title: Polyglot AI: Multilingual Translation Service
projects.subtitle: Cloud Computing, ASU
projects.description: AI-powered multilingual translation service using Hugging Face Transformers with T5 and MarianMT models.
projects.challenge: Create a translation service that can handle multiple simultaneous requests across various languages while maintaining high accuracy and responsiveness.
projects.solution: Curated and preprocessed multilingual datasets, fine-tuned T5 and MarianMT models, and integrated them into a user-friendly interface supporting multiple simultaneous translation requests.

projects.title: Analysing Neural Architecture Search for Image Classification
projects.subtitle: Data-Intensive Systems, ASU
projects.description: Implementation and analysis of Google's Model Search and Neural Architecture Transfer (NAT) techniques for CIFAR-10 image classification.
projects.challenge: Compare NAS techniques without extensive computational budgets while finding optimal architectures for specific tasks.
projects.solution: Explored NAS-Bench 101 architecture dataset enabling rigorous algorithm comparison. Demonstrated NAT as large-scale, multi-objective neural architecture search for custom task-specific models.

projects.title: Telemedicine Consultation Demand Forecasting
projects.subtitle: Data Science, ASU
projects.description: Demand forecasting model for telemedicine consultations using time-series analysis and machine learning with 90% accuracy.
projects.challenge: Predict telemedicine consultation demand patterns to optimize resource allocation and service capacity.
projects.solution: Leveraged historical data from 50,000+ consultations using ARIMA and XGBoost for time-series prediction. Utilized SQL for data management, Python for modeling, and Tableau for trend visualization.
